title: Slide 05: The AI Workshop - Real-World Transformation

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: I'm still trying to wrap my head around how quickly we could adapt these tools into our workflow...

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: It's surprisingly intuitive once you start. The learning curve isn't nearly as steep as picking up a new framework.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: But who's going to teach us? I don't want to spend weeks figuring out optimal prompting strategies.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: We could start with some online tutorials and...

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: Hey guys! Did I hear someone talking about AI coding? Have you heard Joel's doing an AI workshop in Golden next week?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: Joel? Our Joel? The one who still talks about COBOL occasionally?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: The very same! Don't let the dad jokes fool you. He's gone full AI-native developer in the last few months.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Joel? Really? I mean, no offense, but he's not exactly our resident early adopter.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: That's what makes it so wild! He built this entire feature without writing a single line of code himself. It's over 50,000 lines of code.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: Wait, what? Joel did that? There's no way.
audioFiles.emotion: completely incredulous, leaning back in shock

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: I'm telling you! It uses websockets, various APIs, MobX, React, Neo4j knowledge graphs, MongoDB, TypeScript... the works!

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Joel? The guy who asked me what JSON stood for last year? That Joel?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: And here's the kicker â€“ he's doing dot product calculations between vector matrices to figure out relationships between document chunks and something he calls 'Ontologies.'

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: Joel? Vector matrices? Ontologies? Are we talking about the same person who still prints his emails?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: [laughs] I know, right? But he's been working with AI coding tools for months now. Says it's like having a team of junior devs who actually understand his jokes.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Well, if Joel can do it... maybe we're overthinking how hard this transition will be.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: Exactly! The workshop is next Tuesday. He's going to show us his whole workflow and how he built that feature. You guys should definitely come!

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: If Joel's leading the AI revolution, I feel like I need to see this with my own eyes. Count me in.
audioFiles.emotion: amusedly convinced, hands up in surrender

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Same here. This I've got to see. The world really is changing when Joel's our AI coding guru.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev C
audioFiles.text: Perfect! Trust me, you won't believe what's possible until you see it. Joel says he's finally having fun coding again after twenty years.
